description: Borrowed from Polish kiełbasa (“sausage”), from Proto-Slavic *kъlbasa, which may derive from Proto-Turkic for "grilled cutlet," literally "pressed on ashes," from *kül (“ash”) + *bas (“to press”) (modern Turkish basmak).. See the Ukrainian cognate ковбаса́ (kovbasá, “sausage”), whence kubasa, for more information.

nouns.description: kielbasa (countable and uncountable, plural kielbasas or kielbasy)

entries.meaning: A spicy, smoked sausage of a particular kind from Eastern Europe.
